page.title: 16R.A.F. C/O INTERVIEW
page.content: DANIEL,ALEC AND MARK INTERVIEWED GROUP CAPTAIN SHERRINGTON, THE COMMANDING OFFICER OF R.A.F. HEREFORD CREDENHILL HE HAS BEEN POSTED ALL OVER THE WORLD AND HAS BEEN TO HEREFORD 3 TIMES.HE LOVES THE AREA ,HOPING TO RETIRE HERE THE R.A.F. HAS CHANGED CONSIDERALLY IT IS MUCH SMALLER WITH LESS STATIONS AND PERSONNEL. THERE ARE NOW COMPUTERS EVERYWHERE, AND GENERALLY "A GIANT LEAP FORWARD IN TECHNOLOGY." THE LATEST PLANE, THE TORNADO IS SEEN OFTEN HERE AND TAKES 15 MINUTES TO TRAVEL FROM SUFFOLK. THE YOUTH OPPORTUNITIES SCHEME USED BY THE FORCES IS AN EXCELLENT IDEA, HE SAYS.IT OFFERS HOPE TO THE YOUNG WITH 4 MILLION UNEMPLOYED.1,000 A YEAR COME INTO THE R.A.F. AND 80% STAY ON CREDENHILL HAS CHANGED SINCE THE FIRST POSTING.AT THE END OF THE WAR THERE WERE 8,000 MEN NOW ONLY 1,500 MEN
